person.persName: John Burnam (Warren Co, KY, merchant, farmer, prov govt rep & treasurer of prov govt)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, provisional government convention member, treasurer of privisional confederate government of Kentucky. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah D. Hines Burnam in 1827. Father of Thompson Burnham, John Quincy Burnam, Bennett Burnam, Nancy H. Burnam, James Burnam, Curtis P. Burnam, and Sarah "Sallie" A. Burnam. Married to America Jackson Burnam in Warren County on April 23, 1850. Father of Mary E. Burnam, Charles Burnam, and Julia Burnam. Resident in Warren County in 1830. Owned five enslaved persons in Warren County in 1830. Resident in Warren County in 1840. Owned ten enslaved persons in Warren County in 1840. Member of the House of Representatives for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1844. Merchant in Warren County in 1850. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons and held three enslaved persons as guardian in Warren County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Appointed treasurer of the Provisional Confederate State Administration of Kentucky on December 17, 1861.
